data.title: Tennessee Williams Tour
data.text:
These St. Louis locations played major roles in Tom Williams' early life in St. Louis. Although he had a love/hate relationship with St. Louis, the city had a major influence on his work - including the Glass Menagerie.

Theatres Peformed in:

The Wednesday Club (now the Link Auditorium), 4504 Westminster, St. Louis, MO 63108

Webster Groves High School Auditorium, 100 Selma Ave., Webster Groves, MO 63119

Schools Attended:

Eugene Field Elementary School, 4466 Olive, St. Louis, MO 63108

Soldan High School, 918 Union, St. Louis, MO 63108

University City High School, 721 Kingsland, University City, MO 63130

Washington University, 1 Brookings, St. Louis, MO 63130

Family Residences:

4633 Westminster, St. Louis, MO 63108 (pictured)

5 South Taylor, St. Louis, MO 63108

6254 Enright, St. Louis, MO 63108

6634 Pershing, St. Louis, MO 63130

Favorite Places:

Forest Park, 5595 Grand Drive, St. Louis, MO 63112

Fox Theatre, 527 N. Grand, St. Louis, MO 63103

The Lorelei (Swimming Pool and Roller Rink), 4525 Olive, St. Louis, MO

Tivoli Movie Theatre, 6350 Delmar Boulevard, St. Louis, MO 63130

Gravesite:

Calvary Cemetery, 5239 West Florissant Avenue, St. Louis, MO 63115

St. Louis Walk of Fame Star:
